title: Daniel Craig Shut Down an Interviewer Who Called Monica Bellucci an "Older Woman"
text:
Daniel Craig | Photo Credits: STEFAN WERMUTH, © STEFAN WERMUTH/Reuters/Corbis Daniel Craig | Photo Credits: STEFAN WERMUTH, © STEFAN WERMUTH/Reuters/Corbis Photo: © Corbis. All Rights Reserved. Daniel Craig Shut Down an Interviewer Who Called Monica Bellucci an "Older Woman" 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 
Daniel Craig took a stand against one of Hollywood's most egregious double standards while promoting the latest James Bond film, Spectre . 
In an interview with The Red Bulletin (the official publication of Red Bull), Craig was asked about Bond "succumbing to the charms of an older woman" in Spectre. That would be Craig's co-star Monica Bellucci - who, at 51, is four years older than Craig. 
Craig had the perfect response to the cringe-worthy question. "I think you mean the charms of a woman his own age," he said. "We're talking about Monica Bellucci, for heaven's sake. When someone like that wants to be a Bond girl, you just count yourself lucky!" 
Watch the action-packed newest trailer for Spectre 
This isn't the first time Craig has flown the feminist flag. In March, he dressed in drag to film a video about gender inequality in honor of International Women's Day. Watch it here , and read Craig's full interview with The Red Bulletin here . 
Spectre is scheduled to be released on Nov. 6.
